text: written.- I voted in favor of the report on the draft implementing decision of the Council approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol (10343/2016 - C8-0266 / 2016 - 2016/0810 (CNS))to facilitate the exchange of information, including the exchange of personal data including expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and the provision of support in individual criminal investigations.There are operational needs for Europol's operational cooperation with Georgia, which is increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially since it is a transit country for the so-calledforeign fighters.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: in writing.- This agreement between Europol and Georgia, providing for the exchange of information in various fields of competence, also includes provisions concerning the exchange of personal data.As I am opposed to any exchange of this type of data when it comes to French citizens, I am no exception with third countries.I voted against.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Claude Moraes on cooperation between Georgia and Europol.Created to strengthen security in the European area, Europol's mission is to fight crime and facilitate cooperation between the various police services.I support this initiative, which aims to strengthen our security operations.The agreement provides for the exchange of information and strategic analysis with the Georgian police services in order to better combat terrorism and organized crime.This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Εύα Καϊλή (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, as, according to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, in particular because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against organized crime by Georgia. In this regard, the conclusion of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement with Georgia will help and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- I abstained on this report.The report includes strategic and operational cooperation and thus also an increased exchange of information between Europol and Georgia.On the one hand, such an agreement would be desirable, but this agreement does not preclude the exchange of personal data, which I reject.

name: Afzal Khan (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report as there are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. This strategic cooperation agreement with Georgia would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime and would contribute to enhancing international law enforcement co-operation.

name: Στέλιος Κούλογλου (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the report on Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and Georgia since I find disturbing the fact that the Council and Europol are trying to push through these undemocratic agreements without taking into consideration that new and more transparent Europol regulation is going to enter into force next year.

name: Béla Kovács (NI)
text: in writing. - Support any cooperation that can strengthen the effectiveness of the fight against organized crime, including between Europol and Georgia, which is likely to contribute to improving the security of EU citizens. Even if I have reservations about this and the material does not dispel any doubts. The most fundamental concern is the real way in which personal data are handled, especially in countries with a somewhat precarious status. A bigger problem is that large-scale data exchanges and investigations are being carried out by serious apparatus in order to screen some criminals, while masses of war-fighting adult terrorists trained from war zones enter the Union and are protected as poor refugee refugees. Cannon on the sparrow while slingshot on the tank. Palmyra has just been occupied by terrorists with the powerful help of divers who infiltrated there as refugees. What will happen to you, Europe?

name: Андрей Ковачев (PPE)
text: In written form. - I voted in favor of the report approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol. The proposal concerns the approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia providing for the exchange of information. This information can be in the field of specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and support for specific criminal investigations. I believe that there are clear operational needs for deepening operational cooperation between the two countries. According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, in particular because it is a transit country for the so-called foreign fighters and a major partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups. From this point of view, the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia would therefore support and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which are by definition international.

name: Илхан Кючюк (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the operational cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol. There are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. According to Europol, Georgian organised crime (OC) has been active in the EU, steadily growing in scale over that time. Currently, several EU Member States are facing serious issues with criminality caused by Georgian OC, which by its nature is very international and has interlinked clusters in many countries. In addition to this, Georgia continues to be a transit country for foreign terrorist fighters. Looking from this perspective, the conclusion of the operational cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol would definitely facilitate and reinforce the international fight against terrorism and OC.

name: Giovanni La Via (PPE)
text: in writing. - The aforementioned agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol pays attention to personal data, i.e. the exchange of information that includes specialist knowledge, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, on forms of prevention of crime and also the support of individual criminal investigations. According to Europol, Georgia plays an important role in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters, but it is also a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized criminal groups. . In view of the reasons expressed in this report, I believe that the conclusion of the strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia is essential to help and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, and I therefore vote in favor.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against the report on the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol.This agreement includes provisions relating to the exchange of personal data of French citizens, which I consider unacceptable.In addition, I am in favor of better international cooperation between the police services, but this cooperation must keep an intergovernmental character.

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- I voted against this Agreement, because I consider that it does not provide sufficient protection for the exchange of data between Europol and Georgia, which will be used as part of Europe's geopolitical strategy in Russia and Central Asia, to which I haverepeatedly opposed for its bellicosity and for the effective lack of legal guarantees.

name: Antonio López-Istúriz White (PPE)
text: written.- The European Parliament is hereby consulted on the conclusion of a Europol Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement with Georgia.This provides for an exchange of information between both entities, including personal data.Among others, the information in question may relate to the results of strategic analysis or crime prevention methods.I give my favorable vote since the Agreement will contribute to the fight against terrorism and organized crime on an international level, a fight in which the Union is an important actor and in which Georgia is playing an increasing role, being a countrytransit for foreign fighters.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I stayed.The agreement allows for the exchange of information, including personal data, between Europol and the Georgian police.This information could include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written. - In accordance with Article 23 (2) of the current Council Decision on Europol, the Council approves the conclusion of the Agreement on international cooperation with third countries or international organizations after consulting the European Parliament. These agreements may include the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or confidential information and the exchange of personal data. This proposal concerns the proposed authorization to conclude an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia to facilitate the exchange of information. Such information may include expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, and support in individual criminal investigations. The Europol Joint Supervisory Body gave a positive opinion on the conclusion of the cooperation agreement, taking into account the level of data protection in Georgia. As there are clear operational needs to deepen Europol's cooperation with Georgia, I supported this report.

name: Andrejs Mamikins (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ This proposal concerns the proposed approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information could be in the field of specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, and support in individual criminal investigations. I voted for this proposal.

name: Vladimír Maňka (S&D)
text: in writing.- I supported the approval of this agreement, which aims to cooperate in the exchange of operational, strategic and technical information, including the exchange of personal data.The agreement will strengthen and expand the fight against terrorism and organized crime.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I vote in favor of the report on the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by the European Police Office (Europol) of the operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol, because it is sufficiently substantiated.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted against this text.The purpose of this report is to give the consent of the European Parliament to the operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Georgia.In reality, it is about the exchange of personal data of European citizens.This report therefore directly affects the data security of French citizens.This is the reason why we oppose it.

name: Fulvio Martusciello (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol. Georgia is a fundamental partner of Europol in terms of tackling terrorism and organised crime. For that reason, it is crucial to support the agreement in order to enhance operational cooperation in terms of exchange of personal data, information on crime-prevention methods, results of strategic analysis, and information on criminal investigation procedures. Only by implementing these measures will Europol be able to assist Georgia in its fight against organised criminal groups and foreign fighters that use Georgia as a transit country.

name: Jiří Maštálka (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- Today, we voted on a report proposing to strengthen cooperation between Georgia and the European Police Office (Europol).Cooperation agreements may cover the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.I believe that there is clearly a need to strengthen operational cooperation between Europol and Georgia.According to Europol, Georgia is growing in importance in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially since Georgia is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups.In this respect, the conclusion of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement with Georgia would help in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which are by their nature an international phenomenon.That is why I supported the report.

name: Κώστας Μαυρίδης (S&D)
text: in writing. - I am voting in favor of the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by Europol of the Service and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Georgia and Europol. It is a fact that there are operational needs of Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Georgia. According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially as it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against organized crime by Georgia. In this regard, the conclusion of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement with Georgia will help and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international.

name: Georg Mayer (ENF)
text: written.- The proposal includes strategic and operational cooperation and thus also an increased exchange of information between Europol and Georgia.On the one hand, such an agreement would be desirable.However, this agreement does not exclude the exchange of personal data and I abstained because of concerns about Europol.

name: Mairead McGuinness (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report on the exchange of information between Europol and Georgia.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - Parliament is here "consulted" on the approval of a cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol, the European Police Office. At the very least, it should be ensured that the countries with which the EU concludes such agreements offer all the guarantees of respect for the rule of law but above all of commitment to the fight against terrorism and organized crime. Especially when it comes to exchanging citizens' personal data like this. I have already opposed previous similar agreements, notably with the United Arab Emirates and Ukraine. These cooperations are the fruit of geopolitical choices that I disapprove of. The Council is pushing all these agreements with third countries before the end of 2016 in order to give Europol full latitude for 2017 when its new regulation, even more threatening for the security of our personal data, comes into force. Europol arbitrarily collects personal data in Europe and can refuse to communicate it to the citizens concerned who ask for it. The scandal of the giant espionage revelations by the NSA and the German authorities of governments and European institutions will therefore have been of no use to Brussels. I vote against.

name: Joëlle Mélin (ENF)
text: in writing.- This cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol provides for the exchange of information including expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on prevention methodscrime, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations.In addition, this agreement also includes provisions on the exchange of personal data.Being totally opposed to the exchange of this type of data, and in line with my previous votes on the same subject, I therefore voted against this agreement.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing.- Parliament has been consulted on the conclusion of a strategic cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol.This new international agreement strengthens the cooperation that Europol maintains with third countries, which is an essential tool for Europol's work.I would nevertheless like to stress that the conclusion of this agreement should have been made after the entry into force of the new Europol regulation, scheduled for May 2017. The new regulation does indeed provide for enhanced guarantees, particularly in terms of data protection.Moreover, after the entry into force of the new regulation, the European Parliament will benefit from more prerogatives in concluding such international agreements.The role of Parliament in these matters must absolutely be defended.This is why it is important that the conclusion of any new agreement obey the new rules which will soon come into force.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the report, which is consulted on whether to give our consent to the Operational and Strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Georgia. This agreement involves also the exchange of personal data.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing.- The Council prepared a draft implementing decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and the European Police Office (Europol).You must consult Parliament before taking a decision.In its report, the Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs proposes that Parliament approve the Council's draft.I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard Monot (ENF)
text: in writing. - In order to improve efficiency in preventing and combating serious forms of crime, Europol has initiated the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation with Georgia. The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information. on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data. We do not accept the exchange of personal data of French citizens, therefore we are opposed to all operational agreements that Europol wants to conclude with third countries. Abstention.

name: Sophie Montel (ENF)
text: in writing. - In order to improve efficiency in preventing and combating serious forms of crime, Europol has initiated the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation with Georgia. The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information. on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data. I do not accept the exchange of personal data of French citizens, so I am opposed to all operational agreements that Europol wants to conclude with third countries and I vote against these reports.

name: Claude Moraes (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report as there are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. This strategic cooperation agreement with Georgia would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime and would contribute to enhancing international law enforcement co-operation.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this resolution on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion, by the European Police Office (Europol), of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgiaand Europol.The agreement aims to support the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and their mutual cooperation in the prevention of organized crime, terrorism and other serious forms of crime.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Europol has its headquarters in the Netherlands offering assistance to the 28 Member States of the EU in their fight against serious crimes and terrorism. I have voted for this report regarding the operational cooperation between Europol and Georgia in the fight against terrorism and organised crime, taking into consideration that Georgia is a transit country for many so-called foreign fighters.

name: Момчил Неков (S&D)
text: In written form. - I supported the conclusion of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol, as I believe that this will be beneficial for both parties. At a time of constant terrorist attacks, the European Union is becoming increasingly vulnerable and a sense of fear and insecurity is instilling in European citizens. I call on the institutions, and in particular the Commission, to exercise strict control over the provisions concerning the exchange of personal data and to inform Parliament of the results of this analysis. Ensuring transparency in the conclusion of such agreements is key to dispelling European citizens' concerns about safeguards for personal data protection. The entry into force of the new Regulation (EU) 2016/794 of 1 January 2017, amending the procedure for concluding international agreements, also aims to increase safeguards on data collection and exchange protection. I hope that the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement will contribute to greater effectiveness in the fight against organized crime, reducing the number of threats and acts of encroachment on citizens' rights.

name: Norica Nicolai (ALDE)
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of this report because I consider global cooperation and enhanced action between states and international organizations to combat organized crime to be of the utmost importance to the European Union and its partners.The events of recent years have shown us that communication deficiencies between the structures in charge of our safety have led to unfortunate incidents and the loss of thousands of human lives.Thus, the report adopted today endorses the strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol, which intensifies the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information, with the aim of preventing and combating crime, also creating the framework for collaboration in the fight againstmore and more states with the phenomenon of terrorism.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- I abstained from voting on this agreement because, while such an agreement would be desirable, this agreement does not preclude the exchange of personal data.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.Europol and Georgia want to deepen their cooperation in order to strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime.Given that Georgia is a "transit country for foreign fighters" and a crucial partner in the fight against Georgian criminal organizations, such cooperation is necessary.

name: Maite Pagazaurtundúa Ruiz (ALDE)
text: written.- I have abstained as the reform of the Europol Regulation has not yet been completed.It is better to proceed with caution before signing such Agreements and wait for the completion of the ongoing negotiations.

name: Δημήτρης Παπαδάκης (S&D)
text: in writing. - It seems that there are clear operational needs of Europol to deepen operational cooperation with Georgia. According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially as it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against organized crime by Georgia. In this regard, the conclusion of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement with Georgia will help and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international. For the above reasons, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report because I welcome the strengthening of strategic operational cooperation between Georgia and Europol.This cooperation concerns the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information and, last but not least, the exchange of personal data.The aforementioned information flow, if analyzed, can give knowledge of any terrorist activities or organized crime as Georgia is configured as a country where the transit of foreign fighters is recorded and organized criminal groups proliferate.The international connotation of the fight against terrorism and organized crime leads me to believe that cooperation between the EU and Georgia in this area of reference is valuable, so I voted in favor.

name: Eva Paunova (PPE)
text: in writing. – I supported this operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia because it provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information could be in the field of specialist knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime-prevention methods, and support in individual criminal investigations. I believe it is important to maintain a good relationship with EU neighbouring countries and that this agreement will deliver on this objective.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - I support this proposal for an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia as it will allow the exchange of information, including expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analyzes, exchange of information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and the provision of support in individual criminal investigations. There are clear operational needs to deepen Europol's operational cooperation with Georgia. According to Europol, Georgia is increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially because it is a transit country for the so-called. foreign fighters and is a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups. Therefore, in this regard, the conclusion of an agreement on strategic and operational cooperation with Georgia would support and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international. I support this proposal because the security of EU citizens must not be called into question.

name: Tonino Picula (S&D)
text: written.- Georgia is a close neighbor of the EU and a country that is a potential candidate.We have developed relations with it in many areas, so our partnership in the fight against terrorism and organized crime is increasingly important - due to the clear operational need to deepen Europol's cooperation with Georgia, an agreement on strategic and operational cooperation is needed to strengthen the fight against these internationalchallenges.The agreement will allow the exchange of information, including the exchange of personal data.I would like to emphasize that it is disappointing that the European Parliament cannot fully exercise democratic scrutiny in this process.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - Europol is a European Union agency that is part of the federalist deepening of the European integration process, with the main objective of enforcing the law. An infrastructure that, on the margins of the Member States, imposes and overlaps them, in a clear stance contrary to their sovereignty and the autonomy of their own security forces and the desirable cooperation between States. This report proposes the approval of an “Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and Georgia”, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information may include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, as well as methods of crime prevention, as well as support in certain criminal investigations. Georgia's geopolitical framework constitutes yet another front of confrontation and encirclement of the Russian Federation, in a context of destabilization and wars promoted by the USA and the EU in the Middle East, with an emphasis currently on Syria. We voted against.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing. - I believe that there is a clear need to strengthen operational cooperation between Europol and Georgia. According to Europol, Georgia is growing in importance in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially since Georgia is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups. That is why I support the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia, which will help in the fight against terrorism and organized crime. This proposal concerns an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia that allows for the exchange of information, including personal data. This information could include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods and support for specific criminal investigations. I believe that this mutually beneficial agreement will make both Europol and the Georgian security forces more efficient.

name: Tomasz Piotr Poręba (ECR)
text: in writing.- The report concerns the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Georgia.It is imperative that Europol deepen its operational cooperation with Georgia, a key partner of the European Union in the Eastern Partnership.Security and the fight against crime are a fundamental imperative in order to fully achieve the goals of this cooperation.I hereby support the report.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: in writing.- I spoke in favor of this agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol.The exchange of information will enable EU Member States and Georgia to prevent organized crime, terrorism and other forms of international crime.The fight against these phenomena is a constant struggle.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. - This document concerns the approval of the proposal for an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Georgia, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. In accordance with Article 23 (2) of the Council Decision on Europol, it is for the Council to approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third States, after consulting the European Parliament. These agreements may relate to the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information. According to Europol, Georgia plays an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime, especially as it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters. Thus, the signing of a strategic and operational cooperation agreement with this State will facilitate and reinforce the fight against terrorism and other heinous forms of crime. Therefore, I approve this report.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP MEPs have voted against this legislative report. UKIP do no support Europol as an institution and do not support the EU concluding agreements with third countries.

name: Liliana Rodrigues (S&D)
text: in writing. - This agreement concerns the approval of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Georgia, providing for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information may include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, as well as methods of crime prevention, as well as support in certain criminal investigations. At the operational level, there seems to be a clear need for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. According to this agency, Georgia is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime, mainly because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against organized crime groups in Georgia. In this perspective, the conclusion of the strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia would facilitate and reinforce the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is, by definition, international.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: written. - I voted in favor of the authorization of the Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Georgia and Europol. According to Europol, there appear to be clear operational needs for further operational cooperation with Georgia. Georgia's role in the fight against terrorism and organized crime has become increasingly important, in particular since the country has become a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against organized crime groups. This agreement provides for an exchange of information, including personal data. The information exchanged could include specialized knowledge, general situation reports, results of strategic analysis, among others. Although it is regrettable that the European Parliament cannot fully discharge its role of democratic control in the framework of this procedure, it is necessary to emphasize that Article 25 (4) of the Europol Regulation states that the Commission has to evaluate the provisions contained in all cooperation agreements concluded before 1 May 2017, and that the Commission must inform Parliament about the result of this evaluation and, if appropriate, may initiate the renegotiation procedure of said agreements.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report which asks the European Commission to assess, after the entry into force of the new Europol regulation, the provisions contained in the cooperation agreement and which asks the Commission toinform the Parliament and the Council of the conclusions of this assessment and, if necessary, formulate a recommendation with a view to authorizing the opening of an international renegotiation of this agreement.

name: Bronis Ropė (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing.- I fully support Georgia's practical involvement in the European area of freedom, justice and security.The cooperation agreement between Georgia and Europol is a crucial step in this direction.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing. - This report concerns the approval of the proposal for an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Europol and Georgia. This agreement should provide for the exchange of information, including personal data, expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, methods of crime prevention, and also provide support for certain criminal investigations. According to Europol, there is a clear need to deepen its cooperation with Georgia, which, according to the first, plays an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime, mainly because it is a transit country for the so-called “combatants” foreigners ”and a key partner in the fight against organized crime groups. Thus, the signing of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement will facilitate and reinforce the fight against terrorism and organized crime. In accordance with Article 23 (2) of the Council Decision on Europol, it is for the Council to approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third States or international organizations, after consulting the European Parliament. Recognizing the importance of concluding this agreement, I voted in favor of the report.

name: Sven Schulze (PPE)
text: written.- I approved the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.The justification for the agreement can be that the exchange of information promotes cooperation between Georgia and Europol and makes their work more efficient.Mutual support in individual criminal investigation proceedings can be used as an example.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted against this Agreement between Georgia and the European agency Europol on Operational and Strategic Cooperation. I am opposed, because it advocates the expansion of Europol's operational scope, and my position is contrary to the existence of that agency, as it does not act with the transparency and guarantees necessary for an institution of this type. Serious concerns have been expressed about the lack of political or judicial responsibility to which Europol is subjected. In addition, the lack of clarity on the subject of exchange of sensitive data, including personal data, of European citizens with third countries is something that is impossible to approve since the protection of personal data and the rights of citizens are in question. and citizens. On the other hand, from a geopolitical point of view, this agreement with Georgia is part of the Union's strategy of tightening relations with Russia, which I oppose, considering this neighbor as a strategic and necessary partner.

name: Remo Sernagiotto (ECR)
text: in writing. - Georgia, in addition to being a country with which the European Union has numerous connections and exchanges, is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized criminal groups. In order to increase effectiveness in preventing and combating terrorism and serious crime, the new agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol contains provisions regarding the provision of advice and support for individual criminal investigations and the exchange of information which may include, for example, specialist knowledge, information on criminal investigation procedures and information on crime prevention methods. I believe that Europol can play a crucial role in supporting and strengthening the action of the competent authorities of the Member States and mutual cooperation. I have therefore decided to vote in favor of concluding this agreement.

name: Jill Seymour (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this as I do not recognise Europol.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Today I voted in favour of this report, as there are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. This strategic cooperation agreement with Georgia would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime and would contribute to enhancing international law enforcement co-operation.

name: Branislav Škripek (ECR)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor.I agree with the Council's proposal to conclude an agreement between Georgia and Europol.This agreement covers operational and strategic cooperation, including the exchange of information, including personal data.Georgia is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, in particular because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups.I therefore welcome this Council proposal.

name: Davor Škrlec (Verts/ALE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report, but this explanation of vote arises as a critique of the current system of evaluating the work of MPs in the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities highlighted in Croatia, which does not reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and success.actions.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - I have given my consent to the approval of the agreement between Europol and Georgia, but I believe that in future it will be necessary for the European Parliament to have greater oversight over the conclusion of such international agreements. The Lisbon Treaty changes the rules and from 1 May 2017 it will be necessary to involve Parliament in democratic scrutiny, especially in matters of personal data protection. In the case of the agreement with Georgia, the pre-Lisbon procedure was still applied, mainly because the country already has a high level of data protection. Europol's agreements with third countries allow for the exchange of operational, strategic and technical information, or even classified information. Such operational cooperation also presupposes the exchange of personal data. Georgia is an important partner for Europol in the fight against terrorism and organized crime. Operational cooperation needs to be deepened, in particular because Georgia is a transit country for some foreign fighters, but also an important partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups. I therefore hope that the exchange of expertise, general situation reports, the results of investigations or regular exchanges of information on investigation procedures will be mutually beneficial.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
text: in writing.- We must fight organized crime and terrorism globally.Georgia is a strategic country in the Caucasus, a region where important groups active in the field of drug distribution and other illegal activities come from.I welcome this agreement and I believe that similar agreements will be concluded with an increasing number of states.

name: Dubravka Šuica (PPE)
text: written. - This proposal concerns the authorization of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia to facilitate the exchange of information, including the exchange of personal data. The conclusion of this new international agreement is proposed on the basis of the Council Decision on Europol (Decision 2009/371 / JHA). On 11 May 2016, the new Europol Regulation (2016/794 / EU) entered into force, under which the procedure for concluding international agreements and the relevant provisions and measures for the protection of personal data of European citizens were significantly amended. While it is disappointing that the European Parliament cannot fully exercise democratic scrutiny in this process, it should be noted that the Commission should evaluate the provisions, especially those relating to data protection, and inform Parliament of the results of such evaluation and initiate reopening procedures if necessary. . I support the resolution on the conclusion of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol. Namely, Georgia is increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime and is a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups. Therefore, the conclusion of this agreement would support and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the draft Council Implementing Decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and the European Police Office (Europol).I support the approval of operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol, which will include the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.Closer cooperation between Georgia and Europol is also important from the point of view of the fight against terrorism and organized crime, because Georgia is a transit country.

name: Νεοκλής Συλικιώτης (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - Although the issue of the exchange of personal data did not arise in this report, we have always been critical of the Europol agreements. We fully support the fight against organized crime and trafficking in human beings. At the same time, however, we want to see police cooperation at the state level. This agreement is more political and is part of creating pressure on Russia and increasing EU policy in Georgia. For these reasons we voted against the report.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (NI)
text: in writing. - The act demonstrates that commitments in the areas of information exchange are subject to either personal will or national security accreditations, with the recent example of the bombers of the terrorist attacks in Paris and Brussels, where Member States' secret services did not inform each other. The agreement does not really strengthen the risk-based approach nor does it guarantee the obligation of data protection by design and default, taking into account international practice but mainly the degree of protection of personal data by the Georgian authorities.

name: Tibor Szanyi (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the EP giving its consent to the agreement between Europol and the Government of Georgia on strategic and operational law enforcement cooperation.The agreement can obviously also contribute to the security of the EU and its Member States by strengthening joint action against cross-border crime.At the same time, I am aware that it also raises questions, as it is still being concluded under the pre-Lisbon legal basis, which could be a matter of concern on the one hand in terms of data protection and on the other hand in terms of reducing the EP's decision-making role.However, given that a number of similar agreements have recently been concluded between Europol and third States, the refusal of parliamentary consent would not be politically and practically possible in this case either.

name: Claudia Țapardel (S&D)
text: signed up. - In recent years, the European Union has set itself the objective of combating and eradicating negative phenomena, such as terrorism, cross-border organized crime, arms, human and drug trafficking, and other illegal activities. Achieving this goal is the task of Europol, the Union's specialized agency, whose role has grown significantly in recent years. In order to carry out its activities as efficiently as possible, Europol has concluded a series of operational and strategic cooperation agreements with certain States with which the Union has privileged relations, agreements to facilitate cooperation between the specialized agencies of both parties, including the exchange of operational and strategic information. technical or classified. Georgia is a key EU partner in the Eastern Partnership, which has signed a Stabilization and Association Agreement with the Union and has made significant progress in adopting European legislation in all areas. The signing of the Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and Georgia is an important step towards strengthening cooperation between the two parties, which will also have a positive influence on facilitating the mobility of European and Georgian citizens. I think this is a welcome agreement, the adoption of which will help strengthen the strategic relationship between the EU and Georgia.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of my colleague's text.Europol seems to have a clear need to strengthen its operational collaboration with Georgia.According to Europol, Georgia is playing an increasingly important role in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, more precisely because it is a transit country for foreign fighters and an essential partner in the fight against organized criminal groups.Georgians.Seen in this light, the conclusion of this strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia would therefore facilitate and intensify the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international in character.

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ The proposal for an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Europol and Georgia seeks to support and strengthen cooperation between Member States and Georgia in order to prevent and combat organised crime, terrorism and other forms of serious criminal activity affecting Member States. Specifically, the agreement includes the exchange of operational, strategic and technical information, including personal data and classified information. I voted in favour of the agreement because Georgia is a key strategic partner for the EU and should therefore be regarded equally as a key strategic partner for Europol.

name: Ivica Tolić (PPE)
text: written.- I support the "Motion for a resolution on the agreement and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol" in accordance with Article 23 (2) of the Council Decision on Europol.The operational and strategic agreement between the European Police Office and Georgia involves the exchange of operational, strategic and technical information.At a time of confronting the dangers of terrorism on a global scale, there is a strong operational need for cooperation between Europol and Georgia.Since Georgia is a transit country for the so-calledforeign fighters, has become one of the key partners of the European Union in establishing an organized mechanism that will reduce and control the penetration of members of terrorist groups into the territory of the European Union.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: written.- Georgia is an increasingly important partner of the European Union in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, because it is a transit country for the so-called.foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups.The proposed Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol will create the conditions for deepening the European Union's cooperation with Georgia in terms of better exchange of information.This information includes expertise, general status reports, results of strategic analysis, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on crime prevention methods, and support in individual criminal investigations.As I believe that the European Union will benefit greatly from concluding this agreement and deepening cooperation with Georgia as a key partner in the Eastern Partnership, I supported this report.

name: Romana Tomc (PPE)
text: in writing.- I supported Europol's draft legislative resolution on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion of an operational and strategic cooperation agreement between Georgia and the European Police Office (Europol).Europol's operational cooperation with Ukraine seems urgently needed.According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially as a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups.In this respect, the conclusion of this Strategic and Operational Cooperation Agreement with Georgia would contribute to and strengthen the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international.

name: Mylène Troszczynski (ENF)
text: in writing. - In order to improve efficiency in preventing and combating serious forms of crime, Europol has initiated the procedure for concluding an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation with Georgia. The terms of cooperation governed by the operational and strategic agreement provide for exchanges of information which may include expertise, general reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures and information. on methods of crime prevention, participation in training activities, as well as the provision of advice and support in specific criminal investigations. In addition, the agreement contains provisions relating to the exchange of personal data. I do not accept the exchange of personal data of French citizens, therefore I am opposed to all operational agreements that Europol wants to conclude with third countries. I voted against.

name: Kazimierz Michał Ujazdowski (ECR)
text: in writing.- Europol needs to deepen operational cooperation with Georgia.It is one of the key partners of the European Union within the Eastern Partnership, and security and the fight against crime are the basic tasks of our cooperation.I voted in favor of the report.

name: István Ujhelyi (S&D)
text: in writing.- Under the current Council Decision on Europol, the Council, after consulting the European Parliament, must approve the conclusion of international cooperation agreements with third countries or international organizations.Such an agreement may cover the exchange of operational, strategic, technical or classified information.The operational cooperation agreement also covers the exchange of personal data.I supported it with my vote.

name: Miguel Urbán Crespo (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - The proposal refers to the approval of the conclusion of an Agreement between Georgia and Europol on Operational and Strategic Cooperation. As happened in the November session with the proposal for a similar Agreement with Ukraine (although in this case the chapter on the exchange of personal data is not included), Georgia, in addition to being a piece of the geopolitical game between the Union, the USA. The United States and Russia are still a country that is far from reaching the standards required by the Union's regulations regarding human rights; criteria that our group takes into account when approving any cooperation agreement. On the other hand, the European Parliament has voted on a new Regulation for Europol that will enter into force next year, in which the Cooperation Agreements will be established through a much more transparent procedure than the current one. There are not enough reasons to hastily approve an agreement with a country for which we do not have sufficient democratic and legal guarantees. Therefore, I have voted against.

name: Ernest Urtasun (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. – I voted in favour of the Agreement on Operational and Strategic Cooperation between Georgia and Europol because as organised crime does not stop at national borders, it is also essential to have cooperation initiatives with non-EU countries and international organisations.

name: Ramón Luis Valcárcel Siso (PPE)
text: written.- This proposal addresses the Agreement between Georgia and Europol on Operational and Strategic Cooperation, laying the legal foundations that allow the exchange of information between this body and the Eurasian country.The data transfer will be carried out in the areas related to specialized knowledge, reports that address the general situation, results of strategic analysis, information regarding criminal investigation procedures, crime prevention methods and support toparticular criminal investigations.Trusting that this agreement will help to combat organized crime more effectively on the international stage, I have decided to vote in favor.

name: Ángela Vallina (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted against this Agreement between Georgia and the European agency Europol on Operational and Strategic Cooperation. I am opposed because it advocates the expansion of Europol's operational scope, and our position is contrary to the existence of such an agency, since it does not act with the transparency and guarantees necessary for an institution of this type. Serious concerns have been expressed about the lack of political or judicial accountability to which Europol is subjected. Furthermore, the lack of clarity on the subject of exchanging sensitive data, including personal data, of European citizens with third countries, is something that is impossible to approve since the protection of personal data and the rights of citizens are in question. On the other hand, from a geopolitical point of view, this agreement with Georgia is part of the Union's strategy of tightening relations with Russia, which I am opposed to, considering this neighbor as a strategic and necessary partner.

name: Hilde Vautmans (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor because Europol seems to have a clear operational need for enhanced cooperation with Georgia.According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, in particular because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an essential partner in the fight against organized Georgian crime groups.In this respect, the conclusion of the strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia promotes and strengthens the fight against terrorism and organized crime, which is by definition international.

name: Miguel Viegas (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - This report proposes the approval of an “Operational and Strategic Cooperation Agreement between Europol and Georgia”, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data. Such information may include expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, as well as methods of crime prevention, as well as support in certain criminal investigations. According to Europol, "Georgia plays an increasingly important role in the fight against organized crime, mainly because it is a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and a key partner in the fight against organized crime groups in Georgia". Georgia's geopolitical framework constitutes yet another front of confrontation and encirclement of the Russian Federation, in a context of destabilization and wars promoted by the USA and the EU in the Middle East, with an emphasis currently on Syria. We vote against.

name: Harald Vilimsky (ENF)
text: written.- The proposal includes strategic and operational cooperation and thus also an increased exchange of information between Europol and Georgia.On the one hand, such an agreement would be desirable.However, this agreement does not exclude the exchange of personal data and I abstained because of concerns about Europol.

name: Daniele Viotti (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol.In particular, it seems necessary for Europol to deepen its relationship with Georgia as it is of increasing importance in the fight against terrorism and organized crime which, by definition, is a problem of international concern.

name: Julie Ward (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Labour MEPs voted in favour of the report as there are clear operational needs for Europol to deepen its cooperation with Georgia. This strategic cooperation agreement with Georgia would aid and reinforce the fight against organised crime and would contribute to enhancing international law enforcement co-operation.

name: Iuliu Winkler (PPE)
text: signed up.- I voted in favor of the EP report on the Agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and Europol.The rapporteur points out that this refers to the proposal for the approval of an operational and strategic agreement between Europol and Georgia, which provides for the exchange of information, including personal data.This information could be in the field of expertise, general situation reports, results of strategic analyzes, information on criminal investigation procedures, information on methods of crime prevention and support in certain criminal investigations.

name: Tomáš Zdechovský (PPE)
text: in writing.- I have said several times that I consider Europol to be one of the most important for ensuring security in the EU.In today's interconnected Europe, it is not possible for the transfer of data on dangerous or potentially dangerous persons not to work.That is why I fully support this agreement, as cooperation with Georgia will give Europol a more comprehensive and full-fledged picture of crime in Europe, which will enable it to identify and assess immediate threats and longer-term trends in all areas of crime more quickly.Better cooperation between the police forces of Georgia and Europol should also lead to the production of better quality intelligence documents to better protect the security of European citizens and to fight terrorism more effectively.

name: Jana Žitňanská (ECR)
text: in writing.- I supported the draft decision approving the conclusion of an agreement between Georgia and the European Police Office on operational and strategic cooperation.I think that operational and strategic cooperation agreements are very beneficial for the European Union.The third countries with which these agreements are concluded have extensive experience in the fight against organized crime or even terrorism.In the case of the agreement with Georgia, the added value is its experience in combating the transit of foreign fighters.In addition, as Europol has reviewed the conditions for the protection of personal data in Georgia, I have no reservations about this agreement and I believe that it will help to address the current security challenges.

name: Milan Zver (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the draft Council implementing decision approving the conclusion by Europol of an agreement on operational and strategic cooperation between Georgia and the European Police Office (Europol).According to Europol, Georgia is becoming increasingly important in the fight against terrorism and organized crime, especially as a transit country for so-called foreign fighters and an important partner in the fight against Georgian organized crime groups.From this point of view, I believe that concluding a strategic and operational cooperation agreement with Georgia would help to fight terrorism and organized crime and strengthen it.

name: Isabella Adinolfi (EFDD)
text: in writing.- The following report concerns the mobilization of the EGF fund in relation to the redundancies due to a serious economic situation of the company Bosal S.A.The following company operates in the sector of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers.As a result of the economic crisis that has hit Europe, the sector in question is one of the most affected, especially due to the increase in the production of motor vehicles in China and other Asian countries.In particular, the Comunidad Valenciana is one of the Spanish autonomous communities that have particularly suffered from this situation.Although I believe that the mobilization of EGF funds cannot be the solution to the numerous corporate crises, I voted in favor because it is right for the European Union to provide its help to companies and workers in particularly critical sectors.

name: Marina Albiol Guzmán (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- This report refers to the contribution of the EGF fund in individual support measures for the labor reintegration of 250 workers laid off at the Bosal plant in Sagunto, of which 25% will be direct income support measures and the rest activitiestraining and job placement.These measures cannot in any case replace the need to develop an industrial policy that helps the region's economy, with unemployment above 25%, to recover from this closure.Nor do they exempt Bosal from its responsibility in this ERE, when instead of using the subsidies received and the benefits of its activity to invest in its plant, it decapitalized the company in a probably irregular way.But they represent, at least, an aid to the unemployed workers and for that reason I voted in favor.

name: Laima Liucija Andrikienė (PPE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the European Parliament resolution on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) (application EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana, cars). The fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who suffer from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. This is the 10th application under consideration in 2016. and 23rd in the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer sector, for which a total of EUR 856 800 is earmarked for the EGF for Spain. The purpose of the aid is to help Spain to support the reintegration into employment of 250 workers made redundant as a result of the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A., a manufacturer of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers. Bosal S.A. produced mainly for the automotive markets of Spain and other European countries. Since 2012 the company experienced difficulties due to declining car production in the EU. In order to adapt production capacity to demand and reduce costs, Bosal used the mandatory part-time schedules that applied to all employees. However, these measures did not work - in 2015. January 15 the company declared bankruptcy. I voted in favor, following the Commission's positive conclusion in accordance with all the applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, as well as the necessary guarantees provided by Spain for the absorption and use of the financial assistance.

name: Νίκος Ανδρουλάκης (S&D)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund at the request of Spain, because it is of paramount importance to assist redundant beneficiaries to reintegrate into the labor market.

name: Marie-Christine Arnautu (ENF)
text: in writing. - Spain has applied for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund following layoffs in the automotive sector, affecting a total of 29 companies. 250 redundant workers likely to benefit from a contribution from the Fund should participate in the measures in question here. It is important to point out that the 27 EU countries faced a 0.5 million unit drop in motor vehicle production between 2006 and 2015, while world production increased by 31.1%, especially in China, as well as in other countries of Southeast Asia. The mobilization of the Fund therefore seems particularly appropriate. Furthermore, it should be noted that 50% of the dismissed employees concerned do not have a diploma, and that the economic context of the region is particularly catastrophic (there has been no factory opening in the region recently). It is normal for a state to recover some of the money it pays to the EU, especially if this allows it to repair, even insufficiently, the immense damage caused by the total opening of borders imposed by the EU. I therefore voted in favor.

name: Jonathan Arnott (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ The principle of subsidiarity dictates that decisions should be taken at the closest possible level to the citizen – in this case, at regional or national level. Therefore, these projects should not be funded by the European Union. It is absurd that the arbiters of whether this funding should, or should not, be given are Members of the European Parliament with no detailed knowledge of the situation. This project may well be of benefit to the people of Spain, but I am not best placed to judge. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund should be scrapped, which would give money back to the Member States to decide for themselves about the appropriateness of such funding. Consequently, I had no option but to vote against – even though this may be a worthwhile project.

name: Jean Arthuis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this deliberation which provides for aid of 1,428,000 euros for the professional reintegration of 250 employees of the Spanish company Bosal SA Nevertheless, I regret that the payment of this aid is made to thea yardstick for layoffs when it could have been invaluable in helping the company to restructure.It is urgent to act and understand that our companies are the victims of the absence of the structural reforms necessary for their adaptation to the challenges of globalization.

name: Zigmantas Balčytis (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Spain. 2016 November 8 The Commission has adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in order to assist Spain in supporting the redundancies following the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A. 71% of the redundancies related to this application are older than 45 years. age, 78 percent. worked continuously in the same company for at least 15 years and 50 percent. has no education. I therefore support Spain's decision to mobilize the Fund for training measures focusing on professional qualifications, such as those required for passenger transport, or in areas or sectors where opportunities exist or may arise: food, culinary, occupational risk prevention and in the areas of quality control and environmental standards, heating, ventilation and air conditioning projects, and maintenance of industrial equipment.

name: Nicolas Bay (ENF)
text: in writing. - Spain has submitted this request with a view to obtaining a financial contribution from the EGF following the redundancies in the automotive sector, involving a total of 29 companies. It should be noted that 50% of the dismissed employees concerned do not have a diploma, and that the economic context in the region is particularly catastrophic. The funds released would finance, overall to the tune of 25%, actions such as information sessions, professional integration programs, allowances, contributions to their travel and moving costs or even hiring subsidies. I am naturally in favor of a State recovering some of the money it pays to the Union, and especially if this allows it to compensate, even if only a little, for the catastrophic damage which is occurring. the consequence of the total opening of borders. I therefore voted in favor of this mobilization, although I remain very critical of the very logic of this fund, which reveals that the EU is behaving like an arsonist.

name: Hugues Bayet (S&D)
text: in writing.- I obviously approved this intervention of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund up to 856,800 euros aimed at helping the socio-professional reintegration of the 250 workers of the Bosal company, active in the motor vehicle construction sectorand trailers.The company was the victim of the drop in demand which, in recent years, resulted from the banking and liberal crisis of 2008 and from an increase in world production, particularly in China.It is therefore entirely appropriate for the Union to release funds to help workers in their retraining on the job market.

name: Brando Benifei (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is an instrument designed to provide additional support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade. The economic crisis and the subsequent contraction of domestic demand in the Member States have had severe consequences for the Union car market, which has seen a sharp decline in vehicle production in recent years. Bosal, a Spanish company operating in the manufacturing of parts and accessories for motor vehicles, has had numerous difficulties since 2012 that have slowly led the company to bankruptcy and closure. My vote in favor of the González Pons report arises from the sharing of the need to mobilize the EGF, for an amount of 856 800 euros, to provide assistance to the 250 workers made redundant by Bosal S.A. in Spain, particularly in the Valencia region. With this measure it will be possible to provide a coordinated package of tools that include training and mobility allowances as well as contributions for business start-up and training, retraining and vocational training programs.

name: Xabier Benito Ziluaga (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report, which promotes funds intended to compensate and establish measures to promote job search in cases of relocation or company closures due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of workers laid off in the Valencian Community (Bosal S.A.), in the already affected area of ​​Sagunto by industrial restructuring, with high levels of unemployment. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide our concern about the judicial process opened for alleged unfair administration of the company and that these funds are used to disguise processes of relocation of companies that are profitable. We consider, as we have stated in our amendments, that the funds for adaptation to globalization should be configured in accordance with reindustrialization strategies, applying measures to support workers affected by restructuring due to the non-viability of production, with a greater weight of public investments that make the productive sectors of the affected regions sustainable, helping to change the production model and guarantee the future of the productive sectors.

name: Izaskun Bilbao Barandica (ALDE)
text: written.- I have supported this report on the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in response to a request from the automotive sector of the Valencian Community.The Fund supports the reintegration into the labor market of workers laid off after the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A., the company that has laid off most of the workers covered by this application.It will benefit 250 laid off workers.

name: Dominique Bilde (ENF)
text: in writing.- Spain presented EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana following layoffs in the automotive sector in the Valencian Community (Comunidad Valenciana).While the EU-27 faced a 0.5 million unit drop in motor vehicle production between 2006 and 2015 (a decrease of 2.8%), world production increased by 31,1%, especially in China as well as in other countries of Southeast Asia.There have been 250 redundancies in Valencia and it is therefore proposed that the EGF contribute to the coordinated package of personalized services to the tune of 856,800 euros.I voted to support workers who are victims of globalization, but deploring the EU's policy of completely opening up borders which is leading to this situation.

name: Mara Bizzotto (ENF)
text: in writing.- I supported this report authorizing the mobilization of the EGF, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, for an amount of EUR 856 800 in favor of 250 workers made redundant in the manufacturing sector of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the Comunidad Valenciana region in Spain.The EGF remains a concrete and indispensable tool to support workers in productive sectors affected by heavy restructuring due to unattainable production situations.It is important that the EGF becomes less and less bureaucratized and its activation is leaner and more flexible and for this I will continue to fight in the European Parliament.

name: José Blanco López (S&D)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for the benefit of the Valencian Community, which refers to the contribution, charged to the aforementioned funds, of 856,800 euros to reintegrate into the labor market250 workers laid off in the automotive sector of the Valencian Community.

name: Vilija Blinkevičiūtė (S&D)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of this report, in which the European Parliament examines the Spanish application EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana, cars. 2016 November 8 The Commission has adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in order to assist Spain in supporting the redundancies following the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A., which has made a number of redundancies. The Commission has concluded that the application meets the conditions for a financial contribution from the EGF, in accordance with all the applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation. Bosal S.A. began operations in 1986. In the city of Sagunto. Its main activity was the production of motor vehicle parts and accessories (in particular car exhaust systems, catalytic converters, etc.). Bosal started production mainly for the Spanish car market, but later started to produce more diverse products, the company also produced original components for other car markets. Since 2012 the company experienced difficulties due to declining car production in the EU. In order to adapt production capacity to demand and reduce costs, Bosal used the mandatory part-time schedules that applied to all employees. However, these measures did not work - in 2015. January 15 the company declared bankruptcy and was assigned a special administration. According to the Commission, the proposed actions are active labor market measures within the eligible actions defined by Article 7 of the EGF Regulation. These actions do not replace passive social security measures.

name: Andrea Bocskor (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is intended to provide assistance to workers made redundant as a result of globalization, major structural changes in world trade patterns, protracted global financial and economic crisis, and another global financial and economic crisis, and to self-employed workers.for reintegration into the labor market.Spain has submitted an application for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) under the reference "EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana automotive".The request has been examined by the Commission as meeting the requirements of the relevant regulation, which is why I voted in favor of the proposal.

name: Biljana Borzan (S&D)
text: written.- I support this Report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in Spain, mainly in the Comunidad Valenciana region and the city of Sagunto, which refers to 250 redundant employees from Bosal S.A.

name: Lynn Boylan and Liadh Ní Riada (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. – I supported this Mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund because it sought to give funding to workers who were made redundant and help them re-skill and develop personally and professionally in order to help them find employment in a different economic sector.

name: Renata Briano (S&D)
