text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is useful for providing support to redundant workers and self-employed workers whose activity has ceased as a result of major changes in the structure of world trade due to globalization, or due to the persistence of the crisisglobal financial and economic crisis or due to a new supra-regional economic and financial crisis.The Fund should be used to assist them in their reintegration into the labor market, updating their training and giving them financial support at the same time.It is therefore appropriate to mobilize the EGF to provide a financial contribution to the workers of the Comunidad Valenciana automotive who have suffered serious disruptions as a result of these phenomena.

name: Steeve Briois (ENF)
text: in writing. - This report aims to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of 250 workers made redundant in the automotive industry in Spain. These funds will be used to finance reorientation and professional reintegration programs for these workers. It is important to stress that the production of motor vehicles contracted by 0.5 million units between 2006 and 2015 in the European Union while world production increased by 31%. Our industry suffers from the effects of unfair international competition exacerbated by social, environmental and monetary dumping practiced in particular by emerging countries. Failing to tackle the roots of deindustrialization in member states, the European Union prefers to sprinkle taxpayers' money to mitigate the disastrous consequences of savage globalization. All the same, I voted in favor of this text, in solidarity with the Spanish workers who, as in France, suffer from the errors of European employment policies.

name: Daniel Buda (PPE)
text: signed up. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has a key role to play in supporting workers affected by structural changes in world trade practices. In this situation, the European Adjustment Fund was requested by Spain to promote the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant after the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A. The issues that triggered these redundancies occurred amid declining vehicle production in the European Union. Therefore, Bosal took a number of actions to reduce its costs and adapt its production capacity, but these proved to be insufficient. By mobilizing this fund, workers will benefit from various active measures in the labor market, such as: vocational counseling services, job search facilitation, integrated training, job search and training allowances. I am in favor of this request because I consider it necessary to support workers who have been made redundant due to external causes, through various forms that facilitate reintegration into the labor market.

name: Alain Cadec (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund requested by Spain in favor of the dismissed employees of 29 companies in the automotive sector in the Valencia region.The Fund's contribution amounts to 856,800 euros and concerns 250 workers made redundant.This request was justified given the global competition experienced by the automotive sector and the economic difficulties currently facing the region of Valencia.

name: Nicola Caputo (S&D)
text: in writing. - Today I voted in favor of the report on the proposal on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) set up to provide additional support to workers suffering from the consequences of major changes in the structure of world trade. The application in question was submitted by Spain in favor of the Comunidad Valenciana automotive following the 250 redundancies in the automotive manufacturing sector. I note that the EU lost almost half of its market share in the automotive industry between 2000 and 2015. I emphasize in this context the importance of maintaining a solid industrial base of the automotive sector in Europe, including through exports to third countries of a wider range of high-quality and sustainable technology vehicles. I believe that research, development and innovation are becoming increasingly important, especially with regard to the need to develop low-emission and energy-efficient cars, so as to allow Europe to remain competitive and stimulate innovation. occupation. I regret that Italian companies cannot make more use of the EGF due to the lack of support from local and national institutions.

name: Matt Carthy (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, which ensures help for 250 workers who have been made redundant in the automotive sector in Spain. The EU financial assistance consists on contribution to 60% of the total estimated cost of proposed measures, representing, in sum, EUR 856 800 for the EU budget.  The enterprise decided to close after bankruptcy. This decision had a serious impact in the town of Sagunto, placed in a region of Comunidad Valenciana quite hit by the crisis and a long term industrial restructuring. My political group has tabled 7 amendments to this report in order to prevent unfair insolvency cases.

name: James Carver (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against this binding budgetary report. This proposal was to give EUR 856,800 (60 % of the total) for 250 workers made redundant in Spain, from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.  The 250 workers made redundant worked in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector. The event giving rise to these redundancies was primarily the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in Spain. The money will be used for things like information sessions, occupational guidance, job placement, training, commuting expenses, change of residence expenses, internet expenses, hiring benefit, start-up allowance, participation allowance etc. UKIP opposes the EU using British taxpayer’s cash as dole money for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: David Casa (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report, as despite the fact that fewer than 500 redundancies occurred within the nine-month reference period, this application should nevertheless be assimilated to an application under Article 4(1)(b) of the EGF Regulation due to exceptional circumstances having a serious impact on employment and the local, regional or national economy. Spain has seen a substantial increase in redundancies since the last financial crisis. I also welcome the decision to offer training in skills that contribute to better job performance and possibilities such as Information and Communications Technology, foreign languages and business management.

name: Fabio Massimo Castaldo (EFDD)
text: in writing.- In Spain, the decline in car production caused a reduction in both the number of businesses and jobs, and in the Comunidad Valenciana in particular, out of a total of 187 companies in the sector, 62 went out of business in the period 2008-2014.For these reasons, the mobilization of the EGF is required to support 250 workers made redundant.Basically, I always vote in favor of the requests regarding the EGF, although I am aware that it cannot be the solution to corporate crises.Financial support from the European Union to redundant workers should also be dynamic and made available as quickly and efficiently as possible.I therefore voted in favor.

name: Caterina Chinnici (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) is a Community solidarity instrument aimed at protecting workers who have lost their jobs due to mass redundancies resulting from structural changes in the economic fabric as a result of globalization. The decision, for which I decided to vote in favor, approves the mobilization of the EGF for a total amount of 856 800 euros in favor of Spain to protect 250 workers made redundant. In fact, I believe that the Spanish government's request to use the EGF is well founded in the light of data confirming that the European automotive industry has lost a considerable market share in the last decade, generating inevitable repercussions on the local and regional economy of several countries. members. I hope that the funds provided by the European Union will support the reintegration into the labor market of workers from the Valencia region made redundant after the bankruptcy and closure of the Bosal company, active in the production of automotive components. In particular, I consider it appropriate for the European institutions to show solidarity with the workers of the Valencia region by disbursing amounts that will allow the Spanish authorities to provide them with personalized services, benefits and incentives.

name: Λευτέρης Χριστοφόρου (PPE)
text: in writing.- We support the report, as Spain has given all the necessary assurances.

name: Κώστας Χρυσόγονος (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- The proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund at the request of Spain reaffirms the Fund 's role in an environment of constant economic pressure and restructuring, threatening workers on a pan - European scale.That is why I voted in favor.

name: Angelo Ciocca (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote in favor of the report promoting the mobilization of 856 800 euros in favor of workers made redundant in Spain.

name: Alberto Cirio (PPE)
text: in writing. - I come from a region where the automotive reality has been and still is very strong, so I am not new to the pernicious effects generated by the crisis in the sector; I am therefore ineluctable forced to vote in favor of the report. We are all aware that the significant loss of market share by the Union in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers has generated as many as 13 EGF applications due to globalization. In this context, the request submitted by Spain on 21 June last year for support to 29 companies is accepted, given the need to place 250 workers redundant, with heavy impacts on employment as well as on the local, regional and national economy. A disbursement of EUR 850 800 is requested, ie 60% of the total costs. Through this financial support, Spain intends to implement 12 actions, 6 of which are personalized services aimed at rapid reintegration into the labor market, while the remaining half is intended to cover allowances and incentives. Since 71% of the 250 workers made redundant aged over 45 and 50% of the total have no qualifications, Spain needs to develop more effective training measures focused on professional licensing.

name: Deirdre Clune (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.

name: Carlos Coelho (PPE)
text: in writing. - I support the Esteban González Pons report, which allows the mobilization of 856,800 euros from the Globalization Adjustment Fund for the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant in the sector of motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer production in the Valencian community, Spain, and eligible for EGF contributions. The redundancies were caused by the decline in car production in Spain, which led to a reduction in both the number of companies and jobs and that, in the Valencian Community, 62 companies out of a total of 187 in the automotive sector ceased activity. Through the use of this Fund, created to provide complementary support to workers for major structural changes in world trade, it will be possible to support these workers through measures ranging from guidance / interpretation and facilitating job search to supporting job creation. companies or personalized professional requalification.

name: Jane Collins and Mike Hookem (EFDD)
text: in writing. – UKIP voted against this binding budgetary report. This proposal was to give EUR 856,800 (60 % of the total) for 250 workers made redundant in Spain, from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.  The 250 workers made redundant worked in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector. The event giving rise to these redundancies was primarily the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in Spain. The money will be used for things like information sessions, occupational guidance, job placement, training, commuting expenses, change of residence expenses, internet expenses, hiring benefit, start-up allowance, participation allowance etc. UKIP opposes the EU using British taxpayer’s cash as dole money for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Lara Comi (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the question as I agree with the reasons behind the crisis in the Spanish automotive sector.

name: Javier Couso Permuy (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- This report refers to the contribution of the EGF fund in individual support measures for the reintegration of 250 workers laid off at the Bosal plant in Sagunto, of which 25% will be direct income support measures and the rest activitiestraining and job placement.These measures cannot in any case replace the need to develop an industrial policy that helps the region's economy, with unemployment above 25%, to recover from this closure.Nor do they exempt Bosal from its responsibility in this ERE, when instead of using the subsidies received and the benefits of its activity to invest in its plant, it decapitalized the company in a probably irregular way.But they suppose, at least, an aid to the unemployed workers and for that reason I voted in favor.

name: Andrea Cozzolino (S&D)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund offers support to those who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade due to globalization.In light of these considerations and because of the admissibility of Spain's application, I voted positively to mobilize the fund in favor of redundant workers.

name: Pál Csáky (PPE)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 8 November 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for Spain to support the reintegration into employment of workers made redundant from Bosal S.A., mainly in the Valencia region of Spain, following its bankruptcy and closure. In 2015, car production in the EU-27 fell by 0.5 million units compared to 2006, while global production grew by 31.1%, mainly in China and other Southeast Asian economies. Bosal S.A. began operations in 1986 in Sagunto. Its main business was the manufacture of road vehicle engines and components (especially car catalytic converters, exhaust systems, etc.). Since 2012, the company has been in difficulty due to a decline in car production in the EU, until it finally filed for bankruptcy on 15 January 2015 and was declared bankrupt. The EGF application covers 250 redundant workers. The European Parliament today assured the Commission that the conditions set out in the EGF Regulation were met and that Spain was therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 856 800 under that Regulation, representing 60% of the total expenditure of EUR 1 428 000 and It serves the reintegration of 250 redundant workers into the labor market.

name: Edward Czesak (ECR)
text: in writing.- Convinced of the effectiveness of the instruments relating to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund - application EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana automotive, I voted in favor of its adoption.I fully support measures to implement policies that translate into economic growth and the fight against unemployment.I believe that the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is the right tool to implement such a policy.The proposed fund helps workers to find new jobs and develop new skills when a large company closes a factory or is relocated outside the EU as a result of a change in the pattern of world trade, or when workers lose their jobs due to the effects of the global financial and economic crisis.I believe that the employee support strategy must be constantly strengthened, and therefore I support the proposed solutions.

name: Miriam Dalli (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to compensate the people made redundant through globalisation. EU-27 faced a production decline for motor vehicles of 0.5 million units in 2015. Spain submitted an application for the Comunidad Valenciana automotive for a financial contribution from the EGF, for which they have been allocated EUR 856 800. I am in favour of this application. At the same time, I voted in favour of amendments focusing on a possible unfair administration by the company.

name: Daniel Dalton (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ It is essential that EU expenditure is closely scrutinised on the basis of value for money and I do not believe the EGF is an efficient tool that offers value for money in terms of reintegrating redundant workers back into the labour market.

name: William (The Earl of) Dartmouth (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this binding budgetary report. This proposal was to give EUR 856,800 (60 % of the total) for 250 workers made redundant in Spain, from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.  The 250 workers made redundant worked in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector. The event giving rise to these redundancies was primarily the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in Spain. The money will be used for things like information sessions, occupational guidance, job placement, training, commuting expenses, change of residence expenses, internet expenses, hiring benefit, start-up allowance, participation allowance etc. UKIP opposes the EU using British taxpayer’s cash as dole money for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Rachida Dati (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the European Commission's proposal relating to the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) which aims to enable Spain to receive financial contributions from the EGF in order to support reintegrationon the labor market for dismissed workers.The layoffs, caused by the bankruptcy of Bosal S.A., are part of the consequent loss of market share in the European Union automotive industry.As the country is hit hard by unemployment, the European Union must help with the retraining of laid-off workers.

name: Gérard Deprez (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I am delighted that the plenary followed the position of the Committee on Budgets, of which I am a member, and voted to grant an amount of EUR 856,800 requested by the Spanish authorities.I welcome the allocation of this amount because it helps support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant after the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A .;a company primarily engaged in manufacturing parts and accessories for motor vehicles.In my opinion, it is important to intervene because the European automotive sector is unfortunately the victim of very strong competition from Asian manufacturers.Indeed, the EU faced a 0.5 million unit drop in motor vehicle production between 2006 and 2015, while global production increased by 31.1%, especially in China as well as in other parts of the world.other Southeast Asian countries.

name: Mireille D'Ornano (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted for this text.This is a request from Spain following layoffs in the automotive sector, involving a total of 29 companies and 250 dismissed workers - mostly low-skilled and based in an economically stricken region.The European context is as follows: a drop of 0.5 million units of motor vehicle production between 2006 and 2015 in the European Union to 27 member states against an increase in world production of 31.1%.Funding from the EGF, totaling 25% of the expenditure incurred, should finance professional retraining actions in favor of these workers.I am in favor of GEF relief, even if it focuses on the consequences and not the causes of the economic rout caused by the excesses of economic liberalism.

name: Ангел Джамбазки (ECR)
text: In written form. - Globalization is the cause of the dynamic changes in the industry, which are causing the closure of many sites. I am aware that the Globalization Adjustment Fund set up by the European Union aims to reduce the damage caused by these trends, but I believe that this is not the right approach and that the investment will not lead to the desired result. That is why I voted against the proposal. Growth and job creation must be aimed at, and I support measures that would support these policies, but this is definitely not one of them, and spending EUR 1.4 million on 250 redundant workers would not achieve the growth we are aiming for.

name: Γεώργιος Επιτήδειος (NI)
text: in writing.- The money of the Adjustment Fund should be distributed, basically, to the dismissed and not to reintegration or retraining companies, because this creates specialized unemployment and does not address this situation.

name: Jill Evans (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional assistance to workers who have lost their jobs as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns. It is a means by which the EU can give valuable help to local economies hard hit by company closures, and so I voted in favour of this application. I regret that the UK Government has not taken advantage of this fund in Wales.

name: Fredrick Federley (ALDE)
text: written.- In agreement with previous votes concerning the Globalization Fund, the undersigned voted against p.g.a.that the instrument, as pointed out by several bodies at European level, is insufficient and ineffective in making a real difference to the workers concerned.

name: José Manuel Fernandes (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional support to workers affected by the effects of major structural changes in world trade patterns and cannot exceed the maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million.Spain has submitted a proposal to reinstate workers dismissed from Bosal S.A, which operates in the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers, in the market.The application concerns the dismissal of 250 workers and provides for the transfer of 856 thousand euros.

name: Edouard Ferrand (ENF)
text: in writing.- Vote in favor: Spain filed the EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana - Automobile application for a financial contribution from the EGF following the layoffs in the automotive sector, involving a total of 29 companies.250 redundant workers likely to benefit from a contribution from the Fund should participate in the measures in question here.

name: João Ferreira (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - This application concerns 250 workers made redundant in 29 companies in the economic sectors classified as “manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers”, in Spain. The justification is the same as always: Spain has lost market share in the last decade thanks to the trend of “geographic transition of consumption associated with globalization”. In addition, "European industry was also affected by the decline in domestic demand, due to the economic and financial crisis". Since 2008, due to the combined effect of these two factors on car manufacturing, many companies have closed or severely reduced their activity, resulting in redundancies or reductions in working time. Spain has already approved 9 applications to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, with a view to supporting workers made redundant in the Comunidad Valenciana region since 2009. This is yet another lively accusatory libel against capitalism, European capitalist integration and the neoliberal policies it promotes. We support the mobilization of support for the dismissed workers, but we continue to affirm that only the break with the policies that are being followed by the EU will be able to stop this path of social and economic disaster.

name: Luke Ming Flanagan (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted yes because I agree.

name: Monika Flašíková Beňová (S&D)
text: in writing.- In the present case, the request was made by Spain, specifically for Bosal S.A., a motor vehicle company for semi-trailers and trailers in the Valencia region.This is a request for a contribution of EUR 856 800 for 250 redundant workers.Bosal S.A.since 2012, it has struggled with problems due to the decline in vehicle production in the European Union.In order to adapt production capacity to demand and reduce costs, the company has introduced a mandatory reduction of working hours for all employees.However, these measures did not work and the company declared bankruptcy on 15 January 2015 and was forced into administration.

name: Lorenzo Fontana (ENF)
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of concrete help for two hundred and fifty workers made redundant in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the Comunidad Valenciana Region in Spain.

name: Λάμπρος Φουντούλης (NI)
text: in writing.- The money of the Adjustment Fund should be distributed, basically, to the dismissed and not to reintegration or retraining companies, because this creates specialized unemployment and does not address this situation.

name: Ashley Fox (ECR)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this report as the Globalisation Adjustment Fund is not a good use of taxpayers’ money.  It is not an efficient tool for lowering unemployment and should not be used every time a company closes down or moves offshore.

name: Doru-Claudian Frunzulică (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The application relates to 250 redundancies of the enterprise Bosal S.A. in the town Sagunto in Spain, operating in the economic sector classified under NACE Rev. 2 Division 29 (manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers) during the reference period from 30 June 2015 to 30 March 2016.  The EGF funding of EUR 856 800 shall contribute to the costs of a coordinated package of eligible personalised services, providing assistance for 250 targeted beneficiaries following redundancies in the NUTS level 2 regions of Comunidad Valenciana (ES52), with the aim of providing assistance for integrating the affected persons into the labour market. The redundancies were caused by major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation. This is the tenth mobilisation of the EGF in 2016. Together with the other EGF cases EUR 28 million have been mobilised under EGF in 2016 so far, which leaves a remainder of EUR 137,6 million this year.

name: Elena Gentile (S&D)
text: in writing. - I supported the resolution on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in relation to the application submitted by Spain (EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana automotive), because I believe that facing it is essential that the EU give all possible support to those who lose their jobs to the crisis that is gripping southern Europe. The application submitted by Spain is in fact an exception to the rules laid down for the Fund. But a political and not merely bureaucratic approach prevailed, which gives a perspective to 250 workers with personal stories and hopes for a quality life, to whom personalized services such as information sessions, career guidance, placement or promotion of entrepreneurship will be provided. , allowances and incentives, contributions to travel and change of residence expenses. Fundamental interventions in an area with structural employment difficulties and heavily affected by the general crisis of the European automotive industry, with striking numbers (62 companies went out of business in the period 2008-14 out of a total of 187 companies active in the sector). Finally, the decision to direct redevelopment services towards those economic sectors (food, environment, catering) with greater employment opportunities is right.

name: Jens Gieseke (PPE)
text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund serves to support workers affected by structural changes in the world trade structure.

name: Nathan Gill (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this binding budgetary report. This proposal was to give EUR 856,800 (60 % of the total) for 250 workers made redundant in Spain, from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.  The 250 workers made redundant worked in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector. The event giving rise to these redundancies was primarily the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in Spain. The money will be used for things like information sessions, occupational guidance, job placement, training, commuting expenses, change of residence expenses, internet expenses, hiring benefit, start-up allowance, participation allowance etc. I oppose the EU using British taxpayer’s cash as dole money for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Tania González Peñas (GUE/NGL)
text: written. - I voted in favor of this report, which promotes funds intended to compensate and establish measures to promote job search in cases of relocation or company closures due to globalization. They will serve to address the situation of workers laid off in the Valencian Community (Bosal S.A.), in the already affected area of ​​Sagunto by industrial restructuring, with high levels of unemployment. These are measures that, if they did not exist, would leave the affected workers in a worse place. The vote in favor, however, does not hide our concern about the judicial process opened for alleged unfair administration of the company and that these funds are used to disguise processes of relocation of companies that are profitable. We consider, as we have stated in our amendments, that the funds for adaptation to globalization should be configured in accordance with reindustrialization strategies, applying measures to support workers affected by restructuring due to the non-viability of production, with a greater weight of public investments that make the productive sectors of the affected regions sustainable, helping to change the production model and guarantee the future of the productive sectors.

name: Theresa Griffin (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Today I voted in favour of the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) in Spain, mainly in the region Comunidad Valenciana and the town Sagunto. The application relates to 250 redundancies of the enterprise Bosal S.A. in the town Sagunto in Spain, operating in the economic sector classified under NACE Rev. 2 Division 29 (manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers) during the reference period from 30 June 2015 to 30 March 2016.

name: Τάκης Χατζηγεωργίου (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- We voted in favor of the outflow of funds from the EU Globalization Fund, to be given to the 250 laid off workers.However, we criticize the practice of some companies to use accounting tricks in order to transfer services to other areas and thus avoid labor costs, with the result that employees have to resort to such mechanisms.

name: Cătălin Sorin Ivan (S&D)
text: signed up.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been set up to provide additional assistance to workers affected by global restructuring as a result of the economic crisis.The request submitted by Spain for access to the amount of EUR 856 800 of the EGF for the reinstatement of redundant workers in Bosal SA in Sagunto was adopted by the European Commission.I voted in favor of this report, which contributes to accessing a coordinated package of eligible personalized services and providing assistance to 250 targeted beneficiaries as a result of redundancies.

name: Ivan Jakovčić (ALDE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of the Report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (request submitted by Spain - EGF / 2016 / 004ES / Comunidad Valenciana automotive industry) because 250 workers affected by the global financial and economic crisisdeclared redundant.Bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A.it has significantly affected the local and regional economy of the city of Sagunto in that Spanish province and in particular the automotive sector.The Commission has concluded, in accordance with all applicable provisions of the EGF Regulation, that the application qualifies for a financial contribution from the EGF.I therefore support this Report in order to help the Spanish region concerned and the redundant workers with various measures of vocational guidance, employment mediation, promotion of entrepreneurship and integration into the labor market as soon as possible.

name: Jean-François Jalkh (ENF)
text: in writing.- The decrease in the production of motor vehicles has impacted all the States of the European Union unlike the world level and primarily Asia.It seems to me that the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is very timely here, given the difficult economic context in the region and the bloodletting caused by the unreasonable opening of borders.I voted for.

name: Petr Ježek (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund at the request of Spain, because if the Union's financial assistance to redundant workers is to be effective, it should be dynamic and released as soon as possible.I welcome the fact that the report emphasizes the need to improve the employability of all workers through appropriate training, which will be offered in a coordinated package and will be adapted not only to the needs of the redundant workers but also to the current business environment.

name: Marc Joulaud (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the report by my colleague Esteban Gonzalez Pons on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.The European Globalization Adjustment Fund, created in 2006, helps people who have lost their jobs.This fund will release an envelope of 856,800 euros for the 250 dismissed employees.This amount will be used to finance training, counseling and support services to promote the return to employment of these dismissed workers.I am delighted that this report was adopted by a large majority.

name: Barbara Kappel (ENF)
text: written.- I approved this report.856,000 EUR are to be made available here to reintegrate 250 workers from the former Borsal S.A., a supplier of auto parts in the Valencia region, into the labor market and thus create new perspectives for the people affected.

name: Béla Kovács (NI)
text: in writing.- I support all requests to provide assistance to workers in the EU's peripheral countries, including Spain, which is also one of the countries hardest hit by the crisis triggered by EU economic policy.The rapporteur also wisely points out in good time that the indicators for the European automotive industry are alarming.This is already part of a longer-term trend in which the Union lost almost half of its market share between 2000 and 2015.At the same time, the sector is soaring in Asia and at a minimum stagnant on other continents.So the peaceful nap of those responsible is unique to Europe.

name: Илхан Кючюк (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ As you know, the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) aims to provide support for workers made redundant and self-employed persons whose activity has ceased as a result of major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation or as a result of a continuation of the global financial and economic crisis. In this regard, the main aim of the fund is to help people who lost their jobs to reintegrate into the labour market. The EU should mobilise the fund to support Spain’s submitted application EGF/2016/004ES/ Comunidad Valenciana automative, following redundancies in the economic sector classified under the NACE Revision 2 Division 29 (Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers). In this particular case, 250 redundant workers eligible for the EGF contribution are expected to participate in 12 different measures: 6 are personalised services actions in accordance with Article 7 (1)(a) and (C) of the EGF Regulation and types of measures are allowance and incentives as referred to in Article 7 (1)(b) of the EGF Regulation. Personalised services actions represent more than 75% of the overall amount. Looking from this perspective, I voted in favour of the mobilisation of the EGF.

name: Giovanni La Via (PPE)
text: in writing.- The aforementioned European Fund was established to provide supplementary support to workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade.In November, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilization of the EGF in favor of Spain, suitable for supporting the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant after the bankruptcy and related closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in the automotive market.To adapt production capacity to demand and reduce costs, it first imposed reduced working hours for all staff, but failed to avoid bankruptcy.The support amounts to 856,000 euros.

name: Marine Le Pen (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund at the request of Spain with a view to obtaining a financial contribution from the EGF following the layoffs in the automotive sector, and concerning in all 29companies.250 dismissed workers likely to benefit from a contribution from the Fund should participate in the measures to reintegrate into the labor market.I am obviously in favor of a state recovering some of the money it pays to the EU, in particular if this allows it to repair, even insufficiently, the immense damage caused by the total opening of the EU.borders imposed by the EU.

name: Sander Loones (ECR)
text: written.- Globalization is inevitable and goes hand in hand with the opening of new markets, with international competition, with economic growth and with job creation that exceeds job losses in less competitive sectors.There is therefore a particular need for structural reforms in order to be able to link up with sustainable economic growth.This requires economic customization combined with an appropriate social policy for which, also in line with the treaties, the member states are the first and most appropriate government.The N-VA delegation in the European Parliament understands the objectives of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF), but is convinced that a European transfer union cannot be a means of tackling unemployment, nor a much neededstructural reform policy.The N-VA MEPs therefore voted against this report.

name: Paloma López Bermejo (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- This report refers to the contribution of the EGF fund in individual support measures for the reintegration of 250 workers laid off at the Bosal plant in Sagunto, of which 25% will be direct income support measures and the rest activitiestraining and job placement.These measures cannot in any case replace the need to develop an industrial policy that helps the region's economy, with unemployment above 25%, to recover from this closure.Nor do they exempt Bosal from its responsibility in this ERE, when instead of using the subsidies received and the benefits of its activity to invest in its plant, it decapitalized the company in a probably irregular way.But they suppose, at least, an aid to the unemployed workers and for that reason I voted in favor.

name: Antonio López-Istúriz White (PPE)
text: written.- This report authorizes a mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) for an amount of 856,000 euros to provide additional assistance to 250 dismissed workers of a Valencian company that declared bankruptcy in 2015 after failing to achieveovercome a series of financial difficulties.The EGF was created precisely with the aim of helping workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.In the specific case, there is no doubt that the conditions for making the transfer are met.It has been evident throughout the procedure, in which the Spanish authorities have presented guarantees on compliance with the rules for dismissals and equal treatment in access and application of the active employment measures that are included.I give my favorable vote because it will contribute to the labor reintegration of these workers.

name: Petr Mach (EFDD)
text: in writing.- I voted against.I do not agree with the whole nonsensical Globalization Adjustment Fund and the idea of subsidizing failed companies.In this case, I am opposed to the payment of EUR 856 800 in support for 250 redundant workers from a Valencian car parts company.Social policy should be a matter for individual states.

name: Ivana Maletić (PPE)
text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was established to provide additional support to workers facing the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.On 8 November 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the use of EGF funds in favor of Spain to support the reintegration into the market of workers following the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A.This is the tenth requirement to be examined under the 2016 budget, and concerns 250 workers who have been declared redundant due to difficulties caused by the decline in vehicle production in the EU.An amount of EUR 856 800 is mobilized from the EGF to pay this request.Spain has provided all necessary guarantees regarding access to and implementation of the proposed measures.Their measures will be complementary to those financed by the Structural Funds.I therefore supported this report.

name: Andrejs Mamikins (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. The Commission adopted a proposal for a decision on the mobilisation of the EGF in favour of Spain to support the reintegration in the labour market of workers made redundant after the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal. I support this proposal.

name: Vladimír Maňka (S&D)
text: in writing.- As a result of the bankruptcy and subsequent closure of the Spanish company Bosal S.A.operating in the production of motor vehicles, semi-trailers and trailers, 250 employees lost their jobs.In this context, Spain has requested assistance from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund for measures to reintegrate redundant workers into the labor market.The application qualifies for EGF assistance, so I supported the granting of EUR 856 800 in assistance to Spain in the form of commitment and payment appropriations.

name: Νότης Μαριάς (ECR)
text: in writing.- I am voting in favor of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund at the request of Spain - EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana, because it is fully.

name: Dominique Martin (ENF)
text: in writing.- I voted for this report.This text aims to release financial assistance from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) in the amount of 856,000 euros for Spain.It represents 60% of the total cost of the professional reintegration of 250 recently dismissed workers in this country.This sum would be allocated to former employees of the automotive sector who were made redundant following a significant drop in production in 29 automotive companies in Spain.It is important to stress that all European countries have recently faced a decline in motor vehicle production units as world production increased, especially in China.The mobilization of the EGF therefore seems particularly appropriate in this case.

name: Jiří Maštálka (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.In November 2016, Spain addressed a request to the European Commission for financial assistance in favor of workers made redundant following the bankruptcy of Bostal, which produced motor vehicles and semi-trailers.Unfortunately, the measure concerns 250 redundant workers.According to the rules of the legislative process, the European Parliament must also give its consent to the provision of funding.The released funds will be purposefully used primarily to increase the qualifications of redundant workers, oron their retraining.I voted in favor of approving financial assistance from the Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of Spain.

name: Georg Mayer (ENF)
text: written.- 856,000 EUR are to be made available here to reintegrate 250 workers from the former Borsal S.A., a supplier of auto parts in the Valencia region, into the labor market and to create new perspectives for the workers concerned.Since the EU is supposed to provide funding here to integrate these workers into the labor market, I have approved this report.

name: Valentinas Mazuronis (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (Spanish application EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana cars).The EP agreed with the Commission that all the conditions for the EGF were met and that Spain was therefore eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 856 800 under this Regulation, which represents 60%.a total cost of EUR 1 428 000 to reintegrate the 250 redundant workers into the labor market following the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A.Bosal S.A.'s core business was the manufacture of motor vehicle parts and accessories.Bosal has started production mainly for the Spanish car market.

name: Mairead McGuinness (PPE)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of mobilising EU funds to assist former car workers in the Comunidad Valenciana.

name: Jean-Luc Mélenchon (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - An automotive equipment production site has closed in the community of Valencia in Spain, leaving 250 employees and contractors behind. The Bosal Company is not its first mischief. It closed its exhaust pipe site in Annezin in Pas-de-Calais and in Antwerp in Belgium. Always the same refrain: the site would not be profitable. False! object the employees of Valenciennes. And they just won their case on November 25. Verdict: account makeup to the site in Czech Republic. So the "globalization of trade" that justifies the activation of this fund struggles to hide cheating and dumping. And this company specializes in emission control systems! One would have thought, after the Volkswagen affair, that this parliament was interested in it. No, in committee, its majority voted against the amendments by my colleague from Podemos, which called for the reimbursement of social costs paid by taxpayers for fraudulent activity of a company. The workers are still awaiting their compensation. I refrain from sending them help but I denounce this deposit as a fraud.

name: Joëlle Mélin (ENF)
text: in writing.- This is to respond to a request for collection of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund from the Comunidad Valenciana following the dismissal of 250 workers in the automotive sector and concerning 29 companies.The European Union is facing a decline in automobile production as world production increases by 31.1%.In addition, 50% of the dismissed employees do not have a diploma and the economic situation in this region is dire.Based on this observation, it seems legitimate to me that Comunidad Valenciana could benefit from this European fund.All the more so since it is only a fair return of the money paid by Spain to the European Union responsible for this catastrophic situation by the total opening of the borders.I therefore voted for this request to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund.

name: Louis Michel (ALDE)
text: in writing.- The company Bosal S.A., in Spain, went bankrupt and consequently closed its doors, which resulted in layoffs affecting 250 workers who are now unemployed.The mobilization of the European adjustment fund in favor of Spain will support the reintegration into the labor market of workers and amounts to a total amount of 856,800 euros.I voted in favor of mobilizing the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of Spain because the request meets the conditions for financial allocations but also because I believe that it is essential to support workersin their reintegration into the labor market not only by providing them with the necessary compensation but also by making the appropriate programs available to them.

name: Marlene Mizzi (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour on a report giving the green light for the mobilisation of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) in Spain, mainly in the region Comunidad Valenciana and the town Sagunto. The application relates to 250 redundancies of the enterprise Bosal S.A. in the town Sagunto in Spain, operating in the economic sector classified under NACE Rev. 2 Division 29 (manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers) during the reference period from 30 June 2015 to 30 March 2016. The EGF funding of EUR 856 800 shall contribute to the costs of a coordinated package of eligible personalised services, providing assistance for 250 targeted beneficiaries following redundancies in the NUTS level 2 regions of Comunidad Valenciana (ES52), with the aim of providing assistance for integrating the affected persons into the labour market. The redundancies were caused by major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation.

name: Csaba Molnár (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund has been created in order to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns. On 21 June 2016, Spain submitted an application to the Commission to mobilize the Fund, to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant following the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A., a company mainly located in the Valencia region. The application concerns 250 redundant workers and covers a total amount of EUR 856 800 from the EGF. The services to be provided to redundant workers include the following 12 measures: 6 measures are personalized services within the meaning of Article 7 (1) (a) and (c) of the EGF Regulation, and a further 6 measures are Article 7 (1) of the EGF Regulation. Allowance and incentive under paragraph 1 (b). Personalized services account for more than 75% of the total. The Commission has determined that the application qualifies for a financial contribution from the Fund and that the planned measures constitute active labor market measures within the eligible actions, and has therefore submitted to Parliament and the Council a proposal for a financial contribution from the Fund of EUR 856 800. I supported the proposal.

name: Bernard Monot (ENF)
text: in writing.- Spain has filed the EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana - Automobile application for a financial contribution from the EGF following the layoffs in the automotive sector, involving a total of 29 companies.250 redundant workers likely to benefit from a contribution from the Fund should participate in the measures in question here.I am obviously in favor of a state recovering some of the money it pays to the EU, in particular if this allows it to repair, even insufficiently, the immense damage caused by the total opening of the EU.borders imposed by the EU.Favorable vote.

name: Sophie Montel (ENF)
text: in writing.- I am obviously in favor of a State recovering some of the money it pays to the European Union, in particular if this allows it to repair, even insufficiently, the immense damage caused by the openingtotal borders imposed by the Union.I vote for this report.

name: Nadine Morano (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) for the benefit of 250 workers made redundant in 29 companies in the automotive industry in the region of Valencia in Spain.This involves deploying 856,800 euros to co-finance the job search, career guidance, retraining and mobility projects of these dismissed employees.

name: Victor Negrescu (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund that will help 250 workers made redundant in Spain. The fund will provide EUR 856 800 to help implement the EGF measures such as labour market services, work practice, debt counselling, psychological counselling, study allowance relating to the participants in formal studies, mobility allowance, training cost reimbursement and support for formal studies.

name: Момчил Неков (S&D)
text: In written form. - As a result of the decline in domestic demand in the EU, as well as the weak positioning of the European automotive industry in relation to the growing Asian market, many companies operating in this industry are forced to cease their activities and lay off their employees. Such is the case with the 250 fired workers who produced car parts and accessories for the Spanish company Bosal S.A. The mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) will allow the EU to help Spanish workers receive training that allows them to adapt to the needs of the labor market in their region. I believe that the circumstances which led to the dismissal of the Spanish workers, as well as the action taken by Spain to reintegrate them into the employment sector, are eligible for financial support from the EGF. That is why I supported the allocation of 856,800 euros to Bosal S.A. employees.

name: Franz Obermayr (ENF)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report because the proposal is entirely in the interests of the workers and, in my opinion, is to be welcomed.

name: Urmas Paet (ALDE)
text: in writing.- I supported.In Spain, 250 redundancies were made due to the declining market share of the car industry in the EU.The redundancies are a major blow to the region and the Fund's support will help workers to return to the labor market more easily.

name: Maite Pagazaurtundúa Ruiz (ALDE)
text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is a solidarity-based fund at a time when industries and the economy are facing some of the adverse effects of globalization.With the economic crisis, many of our companies and sectors have been forced to close.In other cases, they have succumbed to the benefits that relocation to third countries offers.On this occasion we voted to grant 856,800 euros of European funds to 250 workers in the automotive sector of the Valencian Community who lost their jobs between June 2015 and March 2016. My vote and my support are with the affected workers, although I take the opportunity torequest that these funds be linked to the reindustrialization of the affected areas and the reconversion of their workers.

name: Δημήτρης Παπαδάκης (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was set up to provide additional support to workers who are suffering from the effects of major structural changes in the form of world trade. I voted in favor of the report, which provides for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund in favor of Spain, in order to support the reintegration of workers laid off after the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal SA, the company from which the majority of which was active in the automotive industry. The services to be provided to redundant workers fall into twelve different categories of actions such as personalized services, bonuses and incentives.

name: Aldo Patriciello (PPE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of my colleague's proposal on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) in favor of Spain as I am very saddened by the situation affecting the 250 workers of the 29 companies in the "Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers "located in the region of the Comunidad Valenciana. In Spain, the decline in car production has caused a significant reduction in the number of companies, as well as the closure of many of them, with very serious repercussions on the local and regional economy already severely tested by the economic crisis. The workers who have been made redundant as a result of this prove to be highly vulnerable, given their advanced age and lack of qualifications, showing great difficulty in lending themselves to a possible relocation. Mobilizing the EGF would therefore allow Spain to implement different and personalized actions such as career guidance, promotion of entrepreneurship and to provide allowances and incentives for redundant workers, also in consideration of the fact that these actions do not receive aid from other financial instruments of the 'European Union, so I voted in favor.

name: Marijana Petir (PPE)
text: written. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional assistance to workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade. This mobilization request was the tenth request received in 2016 and the twenty-third in total relating to the production of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector and its total value is 856,800 euros. It covers 250 workers who have become redundant in the Spanish car industry in the Comunidad Valenciana region. The request was sent to the Commission on 21 June 2016, and the Commission concluded that the conditions for a financial contribution from the European Globalization Adjustment Fund were met. Therefore, there is no reason not to support the mobilization of the Fund. The company has been in difficulty since 2012 due to declining vehicle production in the EU, and 70% of laid-off workers are over 45 and their opportunities for further employment have been narrowed. I also welcome the package of measures announced by Spain, which are aimed at education and professional development and include various incentives for employment. It is important to ensure that citizens overcome the consequences of this crisis as soon as possible and to help them with adequate measures to ensure the creation of new jobs.

name: João Pimenta Lopes (GUE/NGL)
text: in writing. - This application concerns 250 workers made redundant in 29 companies in the economic sectors classified as “manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers”, in Spain. The justification is the same as always: Spain has lost market share in the last decade thanks to the trend of “geographic transition of consumption associated with globalization”. In addition, "European industry was also affected by the decline in domestic demand, due to the economic and financial crisis". Since 2008, due to the combined effect of these two factors on car manufacturing, many companies have closed or severely reduced their activity, resulting in redundancies or reductions in working time. Spain has already approved 9 applications to the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, with a view to supporting workers made redundant in the Comunidad Valenciana region since 2009. This is another lively accusatory libel against capitalism, European capitalist integration and the neoliberal policies it promotes. We support the mobilization of support for the dismissed workers, but we continue to affirm that only the break with the policies that are being followed by the EU will be able to stop this path of social and economic disaster.

name: Pavel Poc (S&D)
text: in writing. - In 2015, there was a significant increase in motor vehicle production in Southeast Asia, to the detriment of the Member States of the European Union. In the case of Spain, and in particular the Valencian region, 500 redundancies occurred in just nine months due to negative economic developments and the effects of globalization. In addition, up to 62 companies out of a total of 187, which specialized in the field of automotive production in the region, were closed. That is why I voted in favor of the report on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund. More specifically, there will be more than EUR 23 million to be used to reduce unemployment. It currently reaches about 20 percent. It is necessary to pay particular attention to the generation in the pre-retirement age, as this group was largely concerned with redundancies. I am very pleased that the local authorities have decided to encourage vocational training suitable for the local labor market. There is a need to contribute to improving the professional potential of all those affected by redundancies, whether through retraining in the food, industry or by increasing their IT skills and language skills. With my voice, I am making it clear that it is no longer possible to tolerate economic deprivation. We must do everything we can to enable European citizens to live in the most dignified conditions possible.

name: Miroslav Poche (S&D)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was set up to provide assistance to workers who suffer from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns.As a Social Democrat, I am glad that such a fund exists, because I think it is one of the EU's basic means of promoting social justice.I supported the European Parliament's proposal to mobilize the EGF in favor of Spain to support and reintegrate Bosal S.A.on the labor market.There were massive layoffs in this company in connection with the bankruptcy and subsequent closure of the company.This is a good way to help these workers in a situation that is costly for them.It is above all an act of solidarity, which I consider to be a fundamental pillar of the European Community.

name: Tomasz Piotr Poręba (ECR)
text: in writing. - On November 8, 2016, the Commission adopted a proposal for a decision to mobilize the EGF for Spain to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant due to the bankruptcy and liquidation of Bosal SA, which made most of the workers involved in this application, operating in 29 of NACE Rev. 2 ("Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers") mainly in the Valencia region (Comunidad Valenciana - ES52), NUTS level 2. The European Globalization Adjustment Fund (EGF) was created to provide additional support to workers affected by major structural changes world trade. Pursuant to the provisions of Art. 12 of Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 1311/2013 establishing the multiannual financial framework for 2014-2020 and Art. 15 of Regulation (EU) No 1309/2013, the resources of the fund may not exceed the maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million (2011 prices). The corresponding amounts are entered in the general budget of the Union as a provision. Pursuant to point 13 of the Interinstitutional Agreement of 2 December 2013 between the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission on budgetary discipline, cooperation in budgetary matters and sound financial management with a view to mobilizing the Fund, in case of a positive evaluation of the application, the Commission submits a proposal to the budgetary authority to mobilize the Fund and at the same time a corresponding transfer request. I hereby support the report.

name: Franck Proust (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this report, which provides for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to help the 250 workers made redundant in 29 companies in the region of Valencia in Spain, following the bankruptcy and closure ofthe company Bosal SA It is important for Europe to be able to come to the aid of workers who have been hit hard by the recent economic crisis.We must allow them to re-enter the labor market more quickly, and I am thinking in particular of the workers in the automobile industry who have been particularly affected by this crisis.

name: Paulo Rangel (PPE)
text: in writing. - As a mechanism created to provide support to workers affected by the effects of structural changes in world trade patterns, the European Globalization Adjustment Fund is geared towards cases like the present. The application to the Fund, in order to support the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant by Bosal SA, was submitted to the Commission on June 21, 2016. Since 2012, Bosal SA has been experiencing difficulties due to the decline in the production of vehicles in the EU. In order to adapt production capacity to demand and reduce costs, the company used reduced working hours for all personnel. However, these measures did not work and, on January 15, 2015, the company declared bankruptcy. The dismissal of 250 company employees - a serious social consequence of the aforementioned crisis - therefore justifies the mobilization of the EGF. In order to support the 250 European citizens who are in this precarious situation and to benefit from measures as relevant as access to consultancy services and training aimed at re-entering the labor market, I vote in favor of approving the report.

name: Julia Reid (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ UKIP voted against this binding budgetary report. This proposal was to give EUR 856,800 (60 % of the total) for 250 workers made redundant in Spain, from the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund.  The 250 workers made redundant worked in the manufacturing of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers sector. The event giving rise to these redundancies was primarily the bankruptcy and closure of Bosal S.A, a company operating in Spain. The money will be used for things like information sessions, occupational guidance, job placement, training, commuting expenses, change of residence expenses, internet expenses, hiring benefit, start-up allowance, participation allowance etc. UKIP opposes the EU using British taxpayer’s cash as dole money for poor economic decisions in other countries.

name: Inmaculada Rodríguez-Piñero Fernández (S&D)
text: written.- I have supported the approval of this aid from the European fund for adaptation to globalization for 250 people who lost their jobs after the closure of Bosal SA, thanks to the initiative of the Generalitat Valenciana and the commitment of President Ximo Puig with workers andBosal workers.The approval of this aid is good news but it is necessary to review the operation of the EGF, allocating more resources and making their access more flexible, so that SMEs, which are the ones that need the greatest protection in a globalized world, can benefit as a priority.Furthermore, it is necessary to establish mechanisms that allow preventive action to prevent layoffs of this type, motivated solely by strategic reasons of the company.

name: Claude Rolin (PPE)
text: in writing. - I voted in favor of the resolution of the European Parliament of 14 December 2016 on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund following the request "EGF / 2016 / 004ES / Comunidad Valenciana - Automobile ”presented by Spain. The purpose of this request was to obtain a financial contribution from the Fund following redundancies in the sector of the construction of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers in the Valencian Community. Parliament together with the Commission agree that the conditions for the granting of this aid are met. Consequently, Spain will benefit from an amount of 856,800 euros for the purpose of the professional reintegration of 250 redundant workers, which will take the form of information sessions, campaigns to promote entrepreneurship, programs professional integration and allowances.

name: Bronis Ropė (Verts/ALE)
text: in writing.- I supported the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, following a Spanish application to alleviate the situation following the closure of the car industry in the Valencia region.The European Solidarity Fund is an important instrument for tackling structural labor market problems and supporting retraining efforts.

name: Fernando Ruas (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of this proposal to mobilize the European Globalization Adjustment Fund (FEAG) in favor of Spain, following an application submitted by this country, with the aim of supporting the reintegration into the labor market of workers made redundant following thebankruptcy and closure of the company Bosal SA, which worked in the area of the manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers, in the Valencia region.After analyzing the application and taking into account the applicable legal and regulatory provisions, it was concluded that it meets the conditions for the attribution of this financial contribution within the scope of the FEAG, in the amount of 856 thousand euros, to support the 250 workers who were dismissed, under theform of personalized services and subsidies and incentive measures, under the legal provisions of the EAGF Regulation.

name: Maria Lidia Senra Rodríguez (GUE/NGL)
text: written.- This report refers to the contribution of the EGF fund in measures of individual support for the labor reintegration of 250 workers laid off at the Bosal plant in Sagunto, of which 25% will be measures of direct support to income and income.rest training activities and job placement.These measures cannot in any case replace the need to develop an industrial policy that helps the economy of this country, with unemployment above 25%, to recover from this closure.Nor do they exempt Bosal from its responsibility in this ERE, when instead of using the subsidies received and the benefits of its activity to invest in its plant, it decapitalized the company in a probably irregular way.But they suppose, at least, an aid to the unemployed workers and for that reason I voted in favor.

name: Jill Seymour (EFDD)
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this as the UK does not receive this same fund.

name: Siôn Simon (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ Today I voted in favour of the mobilisation of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF) in Spain, mainly in the region Comunidad Valenciana and the town Sagunto. The application relates to 250 redundancies of the enterprise Bosal S.A. in the town Sagunto in Spain, operating in the economic sector classified under NACE Rev. 2 Division 29 (manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers) during the reference period from 30 June 2015 to 30 March 2016.

name: Branislav Škripek (ECR)
text: in writing.- I fully support measures aimed at setting policies that create growth and jobs.However, I do not consider the European Globalization Adjustment Fund to be the right and effective tool for these policies.That is why I voted against.

name: Davor Škrlec (Verts/ALE)
text: written.- I voted in favor of this report, but this explanation of vote arises as a critique of the current system of evaluating the work of MPs in the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities highlighted in Croatia, which does not reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and success.actions.

name: Monika Smolková (S&D)
text: in writing. - The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to give workers made redundant due to structural changes in the world market a chance to re-employ as soon as possible. Member States can draw a total of EUR 150 million from this fund each year. Whenever there are mass redundancies in the domestic market for reasons related to globalization, the country's government has the opportunity to request a contribution to mitigate the effects on the redundant workers. In this case, we were considering a request from the Spanish authorities following the bankruptcy of Bosal S.A. to lay off 250 workers. As the application meets the formal requirements, I approved the release of almost EUR 857 thousand in favor of Spain. Bosal was originally engaged in the manufacture of motor vehicle parts and accessories when it began operations in Sagunto in 1986. Later, its scope was expanded and it moved from the Spanish market to other European markets, where it supplied other original automotive components. In 2012, however, the European car market fell sharply, which also affected Bosal. Despite efforts to restructure by reducing costs or reducing working hours, the company was not saved from going bankrupt in 2015. Therefore, I fully support the provision of this assistance to its former employees.

name: Ivan Štefanec (PPE)
text: in writing.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund is an important tool for maintaining employment and raising the skills of redundant workers.In the case of Comunidad Valenciana, its mobilization will involve 250 employees, mainly men over the age of 45, who would be in danger of falling into social dependency.The funds will be used in particular for allowances and incentives to make it easier for them to find a new job, including a work attendance allowance.

name: Dubravka Šuica (PPE)
text: written.- The European Globalization Adjustment Fund was created to provide additional assistance and reintegration into the labor market for workers suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world sample trade or from the global financial and economic crisis.Union financial assistance to workers should be dynamic and as efficient as possible.According to the provisions of the Regulation, which establishes the multiannual financial framework for the period 2014-2020, the fund may not exceed a maximum annual amount of EUR 150 million.The European Parliament emphasizes that the affected regions face a relatively large group of older workers who are, at the same time, redundant and do not possess the skills required by the local labor market.On 21 June 2016, Spain applied for a financial contribution from the Comunidad Valenciana region of Spain.I support this Report because I believe that all the conditions for granting financial support have been met.

name: Patricija Šulin (PPE)
text: in writing.- I voted in favor of the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, the role of Spain - the automotive industry.Spain's application is complete, with Spain eligible for a financial contribution of EUR 856,800, for the reintegration of 250 redundant workers into the labor market of the automotive industry in the Comunidad Valenciana region.As a result of the fall in car production, Spain has suffered a significant reduction in the number of companies and jobs, and many car companies in the Comunidad Valenciana region have ceased operations in the last 8 years.

name: Ελευθέριος Συναδινός (NI)
text: in writing.- Adjustment Fund money should be allocated, in principle, to the redundant and not to reintegration or retraining companies, as this creates skilled unemployment and does not address this situation.

name: Claudia Țapardel (S&D)
text: in writing. ‒ I give my approval to use EUR 856 800 from the European Globalisation Fund for Spain, specifically in the Comunidad Valenciana region and the town of Sagunto. From the 30 June 2015 to 30 March 2016, 250 people have been made redundant from Bosal S.A., a manufacturer of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers. The redundancies were caused by major structural changes in world trade patterns due to globalisation. The money will be used to help integrate the affected people back into the labour market. I support this report.

name: Marc Tarabella (S&D)
text: in writing.- It is normal for Europe to intervene in such cases, it is a question of solidarity, a fundamental value.In order to mobilize the EGF, the Commission submitted to the budgetary authority a request for a transfer of a total amount of EUR 856,000 from the EGF reserve.

name: Pavel Telička (ALDE)
text: in writing. ‒ The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund is an instrument that provides additional support to workers who are suffering from the consequences of major structural changes in world trade patterns or of the global financial and economic crisis, in the aim of assisting their reintegration into the labour market. Spain submitted an application for a financial contribution from the EGAF following the demise of the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer manufacturing industry in the region of Valenciana. Today, much of the manufacturing has been resumed in China and South-East Asia. I voted in favour of the report on the mobilisation of the EGAF for Spain, which is intended to shield the Spanish economy from the negative effects of globalisation.

name: Ivica Tolić (PPE)
text: written. - I support "Motion for a resolution on the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund: request EGF / 2016/004 ES / Comunidad Valenciana automotive industry with regard to Regulation 1309/2013 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 December 2013 on the European Globalization Adjustment Fund" to set legislative and budgetary instruments in place to support workers affected by the effects of globalization. Spain's request for the assistance of 250 redundant workers was submitted in accordance with the intervention criteria set out in Article 4, and notwithstanding the derogation from point b) requiring at least 500 workers, I believe that the European Union should intervene with its own resources. Globalization has greatly affected the reduction of the Union's market share in the automotive industry, and in Spain it had the greatest impact as seen in the Comunidad Valenciana, where 62 of the 187 car companies stopped their activities between 2008 and 2014. Therefore, assistance should be provided. Spain and support its decision on new educational measures aimed at vocational retraining. I also believe that this decision should be a measure of the flexibility of the European Union institutions and an indicator of the intention to help the Member States. I believe that a similar practice should be applied in the case of similar requests from other member states, including Croatia.

name: Ruža Tomašić (ECR)
text: written. - The decline in car production in Spain has resulted in a reduction in the number of jobs in the car industry. Following the redundancies of 250 automotive workers in the Comunidad Valenciana region, Spain has applied for the mobilization of the European Globalization Adjustment Fund, according to which the fund's financial contribution would be 856,800 euros, or 60 per cent of the projected costs. These funds are planned to reintegrate laid-off workers into the labor market. However, the need to reduce the number of jobs in the car industry is not only a problem in Spain, but also in other Member States. In the last decade, the European car industry has lost a significant share in this area by moving to markets outside the European Union, primarily to the Asian market.
